FRED Watch Quickie Film Review: Captain Marvel (2019)

SIMPLY MARVELOUS!

I’m a Kendall Richardson and welcome to FRED Watch, where we review everything from the mainstream to the obscure. Today’s film is the superhero blockbuster Captain Marvel…

Marvel Studios / Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures

Set in the 1990s, Carol Danvers (Brie Larson) becomes one of the universe’s most powerful heroes when Earth is caught in the middle of a galactic war…

tags: Tony Stark will pull a Janeway™ in Endgame
title: Endgame
body:
So I went and watched Captain Marvel for the second time last night wearing a Footloose tee and Cheerios jacket because I am confused. It’s amazing and everyone should go watch it. It’s great. Order the large popcorn so you too can get Brie’s face on a box.

But my friends and I were talking afterwards when I mentioned the jump ports reminded me of the Borg Transworp Conduits™ from Star Trek, and seen in the finale of Voyager. I said to them, oh we should all go watch Endgame cause it is also amazing. Everyone stared at me in confusion, because it doesn’t come out ‘til next month.

Voyager’s finale is also called Endgame…

So what if Avengers: Endgame is named not for chess, but because it’s inspired by the queen of captains, Kathyrn Janeway. In Voyager’s Endgame, a future Janeway travels back in time to save her younger crew from her future. So what if Tony Stark or someone else does the same? What if the one to defeat Thanos is actually the future version of one of our heroes?

Thank you for coming to my multi-fandom rant.

blog.name: originaljediinjeans
blog.title: One Wandering Jedi
blog.description:
Yes, it hurt when I fell from heaven, meaning when Order 66 happened and I had to leave my home galaxy.
IRL: I am a member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day saints. I'm a cosplayer, a fangirl, an artist, and a dreamer. Top fandoms: Star Wars, Harry Potter, MCU/Avengers, Lord of the Rings. My favorite Disney princess is Mira Nova. I'm also madly in love with Bucky Barnes. In case you haven't figured it out by now, I'm autistic.

summary: I don’t think we’ll have real time for much of the sentimental stuff in Endgame, but I want Carol Danvers to get to know the...
body: I don’t think we’ll have real time for much of the sentimental stuff in Endgame, but I want Carol Danvers to get to know the Avengers, I want her to learn their stories, I want her to know about the people who got dusted that were close to the 06 and Rhodey and Scott and how much they meant, I want her to know what they’re fighting for and for her to understand them enough to know why they need her help, and anything less than that will be a disappointment

reblog.comment: I don’t think we’ll have real time for much of the sentimental stuff in Endgame, but I want Carol Danvers to get to know the Avengers, I want her to learn their stories, I want her to know about the people who got dusted that were close to the 06 and Rhodey and Scott and how much they meant, I want her to know what they’re fighting for and for her to understand them enough to know why they need her help, and anything less than that will be a disappointment

trail.content: I don’t think we’ll have real time for much of the sentimental stuff in Endgame, but I want Carol Danvers to get to know the Avengers, I want her to learn their stories, I want her to know about the people who got dusted that were close to the 06 and Rhodey and Scott and how much they meant, I want her to know what they’re fighting for and for her to understand them enough to know why they need her help, and anything less than that will be a disappointment

summary: If Nick Fury purposefully decided to get rid of Goose (maybe after becoming director of SHIELD), what if he gave Goose to the...
body:
If Nick Fury purposefully decided to get rid of Goose (maybe after becoming director of SHIELD), what if he gave Goose to the Rambeaus? 

Here’s another thought: Maria and Monica both get dusted in the Snap, Carol comes back to Earth in Endgame and goes to Louisiana to investigate, she finds the ashes but she also finds the cat…

summary: When Carol Meets Steve: A Tale of Two Marvel Captains
title: When Carol Meets Steve: A Tale of Two Marvel Captains
excerpt: With Chris Evans stepping away from The Avengers, Brie Larson is positioned as the perfect replacement leader.
description:
“I am certain that a leader is required for The Avengers heading into Phase 4 and beyond. Neither Buck or Sam can really fill that role. Not yet and maybe not ever. If Marvel Studios takes either of those characters in that direction, their narrative will involve the struggle to earn those stars and stripes. Carol Danvers, on the other hand, is a natural fit.

Yes, both Carol and Steve come from military backgrounds. However, we should recognize their determination to serve as more valuable than their actual service. They answered the call to be the best they could be, but then they were denied by the institutions speaking. Steve was a scrawny little weakling and an embarrassment to every soldier that put their eyes upon him. Carol was a woman. How dare she. Steve found his loophole by sacrificing his body to science, and Carol had to settle for the role of guinea pig test pilot. Their defiance rewarded in true superhero fashion, and no one can ever deny their will again.

They make their way onto the battlefield and are only accepted after they sacrifice everything they have to offer. Resurrected as demigods, they can now serve the weak using only their moral compasses to guide them. They don’t need orders; they give them.”

blog.name: roaminginspiration
blog.title: Kicked out of Wonderland
blog.description: "I am not born for one corner, the whole world is my native land" - Lucius Annaeus Seneca

summary: Hello! Steve and Nat have an awesome friendship built from trust and acceptance. I noticed in IW they are simply in sync with...
question: Hello! Steve and Nat have an awesome friendship built from trust and acceptance. I noticed in IW they are simply in sync with each other, obviously in tune with the other. Do you think they could start a romantic relationship in Endgame? I couldn't help but notice that Nat didn't seem all too warm to Bruce in their reunion. In fact, they panned the camera to Steve and Natasha, making it seem like there might be something there? It almost looked like a love triangle? What are your predictions?
answer:
Hi, anon! Thank you for your interest in reading my theories ^^

I agree with you completely. I even wrote lengthy meta posts about them (which you can find here, here and here).

I see two reasons for all this:

1/ Romanogers has been hinted at — subtly enough not to interfere with the events of IW or spoil Endgame but visible enough not to look like their relationship is coming out of the blue in the final film. Infinity War was very much about making couples canon (ScarletVision and Starmora) and it would seem logical that the Russos would want Romanogers to get the same treatment. Considering they were barely in the movie, it would make sense that they decided to put it off until Endgame. However, it is important to note that the underlying theme for these couples was sacrifice: does it mean Romanogers will get it too? Or is their romance saved for later because their fate diverge from this pattern? Just some food for thought. ^^

 2/ Romanogers is already canon but is and will remain understated. If that is the case, then we can only expect other cinematographic clues and hints like the ones we’ve been getting since CATWS.

Personally, that would leave me hungry for more. And somehow I doubt that the Russo brothers would simply leave it at that after dropping so many hints and developing their relationship across four movies only to keep it implicit in the end. And they did warn that Endgame would be the conclusion of an arc started in CATWS which is very personal to them. I doubt it would be something related to Bucky (his arc has been concluded) or to SHIELD. The only thing left that I can think of is Romanogers — and the clues dropped in IW seem to support that.

As for the love triangle, I don’t think they will go there. The impression I got from the reunion scene in IW is that Romanogers has taken over, hence why Steve also appears in the shot. So when Bruce greets Natasha, Steve is very close by as a hint that the context has changed. 

I would love to know what you think, anon. Feel free to drop another ask or even a DM.

reblog.comment:

However, it is important to note that the underlying theme for these couples was sacrifice: does it mean Romanogers will get it too? Or is their romance saved for later because their fate diverge from this pattern? Just some food for thought. ^^

 2/ Romanogers is already canon but is and will remain understated. If that is the case, then we can only expect other cinematographic clues and hints like the ones we’ve been getting since CATWS.

Personally, that would leave me hungry for more. And somehow I doubt that the Russo brothers would simply leave it at that after dropping so many hints and developing their relationship across four movies only to keep it implicit in the end. And they did warn that Endgame would be the conclusion of an arc started in CATWS which is very personal to them. I doubt it would be something related to Bucky (his arc has been concluded) or to SHIELD. The only thing left that I can think of is Romanogers — and the clues dropped in IW seem to support that.

As for the love triangle, I don’t think they will go there. The impression I got from the reunion scene in IW is that Romanogers has taken over, hence why Steve also appears in the shot. So when Bruce greets Natasha, Steve is very close by as a hint that the context has changed. 

I would love to know what you think, anon. Feel free to drop another ask or even a DM.

Hi, anon! Thank you for your interest in reading my theories ^^

I agree with you completely. I even wrote lengthy meta posts about them (which you can find here, here and here).

I see two reasons for all this:

1/ Romanogers has been hinted at — subtly enough not to interfere with the events of IW or spoil Endgame but visible enough not to look like their relationship is coming out of the blue in the final film. Infinity War was very much about making couples canon (ScarletVision and Starmora) and it would seem logical that the Russos would want Romanogers to get the same treatment. Considering they were barely in the movie, it would make sense that they decided to put it off until Endgame. However, it is important to note that the underlying theme for these couples was sacrifice: does it mean Romanogers will get it too? Or is their romance saved for later because their fate diverge from this pattern? Just some food for thought. ^^

 2/ Romanogers is already canon but is and will remain understated. If that is the case, then we can only expect other cinematographic clues and hints like the ones we’ve been getting since CATWS.

Personally, that would leave me hungry for more. And somehow I doubt that the Russo brothers would simply leave it at that after dropping so many hints and developing their relationship across four movies only to keep it implicit in the end. And they did warn that Endgame would be the conclusion of an arc started in CATWS which is very personal to them. I doubt it would be something related to Bucky (his arc has been concluded) or to SHIELD. The only thing left that I can think of is Romanogers — and the clues dropped in IW seem to support that.

As for the love triangle, I don’t think they will go there. The impression I got from the reunion scene in IW is that Romanogers has taken over, hence why Steve also appears in the shot. So when Bruce greets Natasha, Steve is very close by as a hint that the context has changed. 

I would love to know what you think, anon. Feel free to drop another ask or even a DM.
